lead_paragraph: Marat Safin, a two-time Grand Slam champion, said he was considering retirement after a 6-0, 7-6 (4) loss to Juan Monaco in the first round of the Paris Masters. “I need to think everything through,” said Safin, 28. “I have no pressure and I have nothing to prove or show. I just want to be comfortable with my decision, whatever I will take.”.
